pr_title: Add support to embed source metadata from git
pr_body:
## Summary
<!-- Provide a high-level summary of the change. -->
Add support to add source metadata from git, to complete https://github.com/buildpacks/pack/pull/1280

- [x] Support current branch refs
- [x] Support current tag refs
- [x] Support `git describe --tags --always`
- [x] Support `git remote`
- [x] Add unit tests
- [ ] Add acceptance tests
- [x] Clean and organize code with proper error handling

## Output
<!-- If applicable, please provide examples of the output changes. -->

#### Before

#### After

## Documentation
<!-- If this change should be documented, please create an issue or PR on https://github.com/buildpacks/docs and link below. -->
<!-- NOTE: This can be added (by editing the issue) after the PR is opened. -->

- Should this change be documented?
    - [ ] Yes, see #___
    - [x] No

## Related
<!-- If this PR addresses an issue, please provide issue number below. -->

Resolves #1137

pr_title: Update error when bp order group is malformed for meta-buildpacks
pr_body:
## Summary
The error for when pack encounters a malformed `buildpack.toml` order group entry referenced by `package.toml` wasn't very descriptive. This PR tries to update the methods used to fetch full name of a builpack complying with the documentation, and update the relevant error message.


I feel the change is quite small and kind of redundant ðŸ˜¬ , would be happy to rework this if there is something missing.
I avoided adding acceptance tests because that would only be possible by introducing new malformed `package.toml` and `buildpack.toml` file combination, but if we see value in them then I can write those as well.

## Output
<!-- If applicable, please provide examples of the output changes. -->

#### Before

#### After

## Documentation
<!-- If this change should be documented, please create an issue or PR on https://github.com/buildpacks/docs and link below. -->
<!-- NOTE: This can be added (by editing the issue) after the PR is opened. -->

- Should this change be documented?
    - [ ] Yes, see #___
    - [x] No

## Related
<!-- If this PR addresses an issue, please provide issue number below. -->

Resolves #1384
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 868451760, 'comment_body': "I feel like the new error message is a little too opaque. If the version was missing, all we would see is:

```
Invalid buildpack 'bp.missing.id@' defined in order group.
```


Based on our conversation [here](https://github.com/buildpacks/pack/issues/1384#issuecomment-1116129061), what if we had two errors:

1. the existing error for when a buildpack is genuinely missing
2. a new error for when the referenced buildpack is missing a version:
```
buildpack %s must specify a version when referencing buildpack %s.
```", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 5, 9, 20, 54, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jromero', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 869151905, 'comment_body': 'Updated the error as discussed, added test as well.
Let me know if more work is required.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 5, 10, 12, 3, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'imnitishng', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 872655279, 'comment_body': "It's a little strange that we're not using the `err` being returned from this method.

Could we figure out a way to incorporate the error message from the method into the message we are returning?

This would most likely change the exact verbiage we wanted but it would hopefully lead to a more detailed error message.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 5, 13, 18, 11, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jromero', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 872657451, 'comment_body': "> It's a little strange that we're not using the err being returned from this method.

Completely agree, the idea was to get the error message that you [suggested](https://github.com/buildpacks/pack/pull/1437#discussion_r868451760).
I'll update this and find a way to use the error as well as keep the error message relevant.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 5, 13, 18, 15, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'imnitishng', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
## Summary
- Show process' working directory from the `WorkingDirectory` param in metadata label
- If working directory from label is empty then use Image's inspect to figure out the working directory (stored as WorkingDir)
This PR depends on https://github.com/buildpacks/imgutil/pull/141, I did not find a way to expose the working directory so I had to go for this change, let me know if there's another way to handle the problem. 
Moreover, I had to update a bunch of dependencies to actually get the newly added `WorkingDirectory` param inside of `process`, which means `go.mod` and `go.sum` are modified.
I think we'll need to update the PR again with the new `imgutil` release if we decide to merge both PRs and go this route, if not then I'd be happy to work on the feedback.
Tests will be failing until we merge the PR for `imgutil` 

## Output
<!-- If applicable, please provide examples of the output changes. -->

#### Before

#### After

## Documentation

- Should this change be documented?
    - [ ] Yes, see #___
    - [x] No

## Related
https://github.com/buildpacks/pack/issues/1422

Resolves #1422

pr_title: bug: Update `getFileFilter` to include parent folders
pr_body:
## Summary
<!-- Provide a high-level summary of the change. -->
- The `include` directive when specified with a file inside a
  folder `testdir/testfile` did not pass the parent folder to
  the builder image, which led to the folder being created by
  docker instead pack causing the permissions of the folder
  to be `cnb`.
- This PR fixes the include logic to get parent folders and
  add them to the file filter, so they get created via pack.

## Output
<!-- If applicable, please provide examples of the output changes. -->

#### Before

#### After

## Documentation
<!-- If this change should be documented, please create an issue or PR on https://github.com/buildpacks/docs and link below. -->
<!-- NOTE: This can be added (by editing the issue) after the PR is opened. -->

- Should this change be documented?
    - [ ] Yes, see #___
    - [x] No

## Related
<!-- If this PR addresses an issue, please provide issue number below. -->

Resolves #1419
